leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 地球科学-遥感与地理空间生态
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 预处理→检测/分割→变化检测→评测
leaf_cluster.tool_form: GIS工具 + CV框架 + 数据集

queries: [WEB] remote sensing deep learning deployment github

tools.name: monticello
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamic quantized mesh encoder extension for TiTiler
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for the TiTiler dynamic tile server that enables the encoding of terrain data into quantized mesh format, facilitating 3D geospatial visualization.

tools.name: Terracotta
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight XYZ tile server for serving raster data
tools.detailed_description: A versatile XYZ tile server built with Flask and Rasterio that serves geospatial raster data as web map tiles, supporting serverless deployment and various raster formats.

tools.name: titiler-eopf
tools.one_line_profile: TiTiler application for EOPF (Earth Observation Product Format) datasets
tools.detailed_description: A specialized TiTiler application designed to serve and visualize Earth Observation Product Format (EOPF) data, integrating with the EOPF Python library.

tools.name: tensorlakehouse-openeo-driver
tools.one_line_profile: IBM's reference implementation of the OpenEO driver
tools.detailed_description: An OpenEO driver implementation designed to interface with tensor lakehouse architectures, enabling standardized Earth Observation data processing and retrieval.

tools.name: franklin
tools.one_line_profile: Library for NGS sequencing analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing tools for Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS) analysis, specifically for processing and analyzing sequencing data.

tools.name: Fuzzy-Cognitive-Maps-FCMs
tools.one_line_profile: Inference estimation for Fuzzy Cognitive Maps
tools.detailed_description: An R package to estimate the inference of Fuzzy Cognitive Maps (FCMs), providing multiple inference rules and threshold functions for modeling complex systems.

tools.name: pystackt
tools.one_line_profile: Data preparation for object-centric process mining
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for preparing data for object-centric process mining, facilitating the analysis of complex event logs and process flows.

tools.name: marine_debris_ML
tools.one_line_profile: Marine debris detection using satellite imagery and deep learning
tools.detailed_description: A machine learning workflow and toolset developed by NASA IMPACT for detecting marine debris in commercial satellite imagery.

tools.name: FuseTS
tools.one_line_profile: Time series fusion toolbox integrated with openEO
tools.detailed_description: A toolbox for fusing time series data from different sources, integrated with the openEO API for standardized Earth Observation processing.

tools.name: openeo-earthengine-driver
tools.one_line_profile: openEO back-end driver for Google Earth Engine
tools.detailed_description: A driver implementation that allows openEO clients to execute processes on Google Earth Engine, bridging standardized EO APIs with GEE's computational power.

tools.name: openeo-eodc-driver
tools.one_line_profile: openEO driver for EODC
tools.detailed_description: A backend driver implementation for the openEO API targeting the EODC (Earth Observation Data Centre) infrastructure.

tools.name: openeo-geopyspark-driver
tools.one_line_profile: OpenEO driver for GeoPySpark (Geotrellis)
tools.detailed_description: An OpenEO backend driver that executes processes using GeoPySpark and Geotrellis, enabling distributed geospatial processing.

tools.name: openeo-geotrellis-extensions
tools.one_line_profile: Java/Scala extensions for Geotrellis in OpenEO
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Scala/Java extensions for Geotrellis to support specific OpenEO processes and functionality within the GeoPySpark backend.

tools.name: openeo-gfmap
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for EO mapping applications on openEO
tools.detailed_description: A generic framework designed to facilitate the building of Earth Observation mapping applications on top of the openEO API.

tools.name: openeo-grassgis-driver
tools.one_line_profile: OpenEO driver for GRASS GIS/actinia
tools.detailed_description: An OpenEO backend driver that interfaces with GRASS GIS via actinia, allowing the execution of GRASS GIS modules through the openEO API.

tools.name: openeo-julia-client
tools.one_line_profile: Julia client for the openEO API
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package that allows scientists to interact with openEO backends, define process graphs, and retrieve results using the Julia programming language.

tools.name: openeo-pg-parser-networkx
tools.one_line_profile: Parser for OpenEO process graphs using NetworkX
tools.detailed_description: A Python library to parse OpenEO process graphs (JSON) into traversable NetworkX graph objects, facilitating validation and execution planning.

tools.name: openeo-processes-dask
tools.one_line_profile: Dask-friendly implementations of OpenEO processes
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing Dask-compatible implementations of standard OpenEO processes, enabling scalable parallel processing of EO data.

tools.name: openeo-processes-python
tools.one_line_profile: Python implementations of OpenEO processes
tools.detailed_description: A Python library containing implementations of standard OpenEO processes, useful for local execution or backend development.

tools.name: openeo-python-client
tools.one_line_profile: Python client API for OpenEO
tools.detailed_description: The official Python client library for the openEO API, enabling users to connect to backends, build process graphs, and execute Earth Observation workflows.

tools.name: openeo-python-driver
tools.one_line_profile: Common Python driver components for OpenEO
tools.detailed_description: A library providing common components and utilities for implementing OpenEO backends in Python, facilitating driver development.

tools.name: openeo-qgis-plugin
tools.one_line_profile: QGIS plugin to connect and process data with openEO compliant backends
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for QGIS that allows users to connect to openEO backends, construct process graphs, and execute Earth Observation data processing jobs directly within the GIS environment.

tools.name: openeo-r-client
tools.one_line_profile: R client library for the openEO API
tools.detailed_description: An R package that allows users to communicate with openEO backends, enabling the discovery, processing, and download of Earth Observation data using R scripts.

tools.name: Minerva
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning framework for land cover data based on TorchGeo
tools.detailed_description: A project facilitating the fitting and testing of neural network models for land cover classification, including pre- and post-processing utilities, designed to work with TorchGeo datasets.

tools.name: openeocubes
tools.one_line_profile: R-based RESTful service for EO data cube analysis
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight RESTful service written in R designed to analyze Earth Observation data cubes in the cloud, supporting scalable geospatial processing.

tools.name: actinia-core
tools.one_line_profile: REST API for scalable geographical data processing with GRASS GIS
tools.detailed_description: An open-source REST API designed for scalable, distributed, and high-performance processing of geographical data, utilizing GRASS GIS as the underlying computational engine.

tools.name: Franklin
tools.one_line_profile: STAC and OGC API Features Web Service
tools.detailed_description: A web service that implements the SpatioTemporal Asset Catalog (STAC) API and OGC API Features, enabling discovery and access to geospatial data.

tools.name: lambda-geotrellis-tile-server
tools.one_line_profile: Serverless geospatial tile server using GeoTrellis
tools.detailed_description: A serverless implementation of a tile server built with GeoTrellis, designed to serve geospatial raster tiles via AWS Lambda.

tools.name: OSMesa
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed processing framework for OpenStreetMap data using GeoTrellis and Spark
tools.detailed_description: OSMesa is an OpenStreetMap processing stack that enables large-scale vector data processing, statistics generation, and tile creation. It leverages GeoTrellis and Apache Spark to handle global-scale geospatial datasets.

tools.name: Raster Vision
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning framework for satellite and aerial imagery
tools.detailed_description: Raster Vision is an open-source framework for building computer vision models on satellite, aerial, and other large imagery sets. It handles the plumbing of loading geospatial data, chipping it into small windows for model input, and stitching predictions back into a map.

tools.name: Raster Vision FastAI Plugin
tools.one_line_profile: PyTorch/FastAI backend plugin for Raster Vision
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for Raster Vision that enables the use of FastAI and PyTorch as the deep learning backend for geospatial inference and training tasks.

tools.name: Raster Vision QGIS Plugin
tools.one_line_profile: QGIS plugin for integrating Raster Vision workflows
tools.detailed_description: A QGIS plugin that allows users to configure and run Raster Vision deep learning jobs directly from the QGIS desktop interface, facilitating the integration of AI inference into GIS workflows.

tools.name: Raster Vision Tile2Vec
tools.one_line_profile: Raster Vision plugin for Tile2Vec representation learning
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for Raster Vision that integrates Tile2Vec, an unsupervised representation learning method for spatially distributed data, enabling feature extraction from satellite imagery.

tools.name: Split Raster
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for splitting large geospatial images into tiles for deep learning
tools.detailed_description: Split Raster is a Python package designed to break down large remote sensing images into smaller, manageable tiles. It is specifically tailored for preparing datasets for deep learning and computer vision tasks in geospatial analysis.

tools.name: pyeogpr
tools.one_line_profile: Vegetation trait retrieval using Gaussian Process Regression
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for retrieving vegetation traits from remote sensing data using Gaussian Process Regression (GPR). It supports workflows in Google Earth Engine and openEO.

tools.name: TiTiler
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamic map tile server for Cloud Optimized GeoTIFFs
tools.detailed_description: TiTiler is a modern dynamic tile server built on top of FastAPI and Rasterio/GDAL. It allows for on-the-fly processing and serving of Cloud Optimized GeoTIFFs (COGs) and other raster data sources, enabling real-time visualization and inference pipelines.

tools.name: TiTiler CMR
tools.one_line_profile: TiTiler extension for NASA CMR queries
tools.detailed_description: An extension for TiTiler that enables dynamic tiling directly from NASA's Common Metadata Repository (CMR) queries, facilitating access to NASA Earth Science data.

tools.name: TiTiler MultiDim
tools.one_line_profile: TiTiler application for NetCDF and Zarr datasets
tools.detailed_description: A TiTiler extension designed for serving multidimensional geospatial data formats like NetCDF and Zarr, commonly used in meteorology and oceanography.

tools.name: TiTiler MVT
tools.one_line_profile: TiTiler extension for creating Mapbox Vector Tiles from COGs
tools.detailed_description: An extension for TiTiler that dynamically creates Mapbox Vector Tiles (MVT) from Cloud Optimized GeoTIFFs, enabling efficient vector-based visualization of raster data.

tools.name: TiTiler STAC API
tools.one_line_profile: TiTiler extension for connecting to STAC APIs
tools.detailed_description: An extension that connects TiTiler to SpatioTemporal Asset Catalog (STAC) APIs, allowing for dynamic tiling of assets indexed in STAC catalogs.

tools.name: JupyterGIS TiTiler
tools.one_line_profile: TiTiler integration for JupyterGIS
tools.detailed_description: A bridge tool that integrates TiTiler's dynamic tiling capabilities into JupyterGIS, enabling interactive geospatial visualization and analysis within Jupyter environments.

tools.name: geotrellis-contrib
tools.one_line_profile: Community-contributed extensions and add-ons for the GeoTrellis geospatial processing engine
tools.detailed_description: A collection of additional functionalities and experimental features for GeoTrellis that are not yet part of the core library, extending its capabilities for geospatial data processing.

tools.name: geotrellis-ec2-cluster
tools.one_line_profile: Deployment scripts for setting up GeoTrellis Spark clusters on AWS EC2
tools.detailed_description: A set of Python scripts and utilities designed to automate the deployment and configuration of GeoTrellis-enabled Spark clusters on Amazon EC2 for large-scale geospatial data processing.

tools.name: geotrellis-gdal
tools.one_line_profile: Scala wrapper for GDAL Java bindings integrated with GeoTrellis
tools.detailed_description: Provides a Scala interface to GDAL (Geospatial Data Abstraction Library) via its Java bindings, enabling GeoTrellis applications to leverage GDAL's extensive raster data format support and transformation capabilities.

tools.name: geotrellis-netcdf
tools.one_line_profile: NetCDF data reader and processor for GeoTrellis/Spark
tools.detailed_description: A library for reading and processing NetCDF (Network Common Data Form) files within the GeoTrellis and Spark ecosystem, facilitating the handling of multidimensional scientific data.

tools.name: geotrellis-pointcloud
tools.one_line_profile: Library for processing point cloud data (LiDAR) on Spark with GeoTrellis
tools.detailed_description: Extends GeoTrellis to support the ingestion, processing, and analysis of large-scale point cloud data (e.g., LiDAR) using Apache Spark.

tools.name: geotrellis-server
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for building geospatial raster processing and display services
tools.detailed_description: A set of components and tools for building high-performance web services that serve and process geospatial raster data, supporting standards like WMS/WMTS and dynamic rendering.

tools.name: geotrellis-transit
tools.one_line_profile: Library for generating travelsheds and accessibility maps from OSM and GTFS data
tools.detailed_description: Provides tools to calculate travel time polygons (travelsheds) and accessibility metrics by integrating OpenStreetMap (OSM) road networks and GTFS public transit schedules.

tools.name: maml
tools.one_line_profile: Map Algebra Modeling Language for defining raster operations
tools.detailed_description: A domain-specific language (DSL) and library for defining and executing map algebra operations on raster data, used within the GeoTrellis ecosystem for declarative geospatial modeling.

tools.name: python-geotrellis
tools.one_line_profile: Python bindings and utilities for the GeoTrellis engine
tools.detailed_description: Provides Python interfaces to GeoTrellis functionality, allowing Python users to interact with GeoTrellis raster processing capabilities, often used in PySpark environments.

tools.name: vectorpipe
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for converting vector data to VectorTiles using GeoTrellis
tools.detailed_description: A tool and library for processing large-scale vector data (e.g., OSM) and converting it into VectorTiles for web mapping, leveraging GeoTrellis for distributed processing.

tools.name: pystackreg
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for automatic image alignment and registration
tools.detailed_description: A Python extension for the automatic alignment (registration) of a source image or a stack of images to a target image, useful in microscopy and remote sensing for stabilizing image series.

tools.name: InstaGeo-E2E-Geospatial-ML
tools.one_line_profile: End-to-end geospatial machine learning pipeline for Earth Observation data
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to streamline the geospatial machine learning workflow, specifically handling multispectral Earth Observation data like NASA HLS and ESA Sentinel-2 for analysis tasks.

tools.name: geopyspark
tools.one_line_profile: Python bindings for GeoTrellis enabling geospatial processing in PySpark
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that provides bindings to the GeoTrellis framework, allowing users to perform distributed geospatial data processing and analysis using PySpark.

tools.name: geotrellis
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance geographic data processing engine for Scala/Spark
tools.detailed_description: A geographic data processing engine for high-performance applications, providing types and operations for working with raster and vector data in a distributed computing environment (Apache Spark).

tools.name: rasterframes
tools.one_line_profile: Geospatial raster support for Spark DataFrames
tools.detailed_description: A library that adds geospatial raster support to Spark DataFrames, allowing users to process and analyze Earth observation data using standard Spark SQL and DataFrame APIs.

tools.name: gis-mcp
tools.one_line_profile: Model Context Protocol server connecting LLMs to GIS operations
tools.detailed_description: A server implementation of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) that acts as a bridge between Large Language Models (LLMs) and GIS libraries, enabling AI assistants to execute geospatial operations and transformations.

tools.name: franklin
tools.one_line_profile: 3D printer controlling software for lab/engineering fabrication
tools.detailed_description: Software for controlling 3D printers, developed by the Michigan Tech Open Sustainability Technology lab, supporting scientific fabrication and lab automation tasks.

tools.name: GeoAI
tools.one_line_profile: A Python library for using Artificial Intelligence with geospatial data
tools.detailed_description: GeoAI provides a comprehensive toolkit for applying machine learning and deep learning techniques to geospatial data. It simplifies the integration of AI models with geographic information systems (GIS), enabling tasks such as feature extraction, classification, and spatial analysis on raster and vector data.

tools.name: segment-geospatial
tools.one_line_profile: Segment Anything Model (SAM) for geospatial data
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that adapts the Segment Anything Model (SAM) for geospatial data analysis. It enables users to segment satellite imagery and aerial photos with minimal prompting, facilitating rapid feature extraction and land cover mapping.

tools.name: Raster Foundry
tools.one_line_profile: Platform for finding, combining, and analyzing earth imagery
tools.detailed_description: Raster Foundry is a web application and platform designed for processing and analyzing Earth observation data. It allows users to search for satellite imagery, combine different raster sources, and perform geospatial analysis within a unified interface.

tools.name: titiler-openeo
tools.one_line_profile: Integration of openEO processes with TiTiler dynamic tile server
tools.detailed_description: An extension for TiTiler that enables the execution and serving of openEO processes as dynamic map tiles. It bridges the gap between openEO workflows and standard web mapping services.

tools.name: pystac
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for working with SpatioTemporal Asset Catalog (STAC)
tools.detailed_description: PySTAC is a core library for working with the SpatioTemporal Asset Catalog (STAC) specification. It allows developers to create, read, and manipulate STAC catalogs, collections, and items, facilitating the organization and discovery of geospatial data.

tools.name: pystac-client
tools.one_line_profile: Python client for searching and accessing STAC APIs
tools.detailed_description: A Python client designed to interact with STAC APIs. It enables users to search for geospatial assets based on spatial, temporal, and property filters, and is essential for data discovery pipelines in Earth science.

tools.name: titiler-pgstac
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamic tile server connecting TiTiler with PgSTAC
tools.detailed_description: A TiTiler extension that connects to a PgSTAC database backend to serve dynamic map tiles. It enables high-performance visualization of large-scale STAC collections stored in PostGIS.

tools.name: xpystac
tools.one_line_profile: Extension for xarray to work with pystac objects
tools.detailed_description: A library that bridges PySTAC and Xarray, allowing users to open STAC items and collections directly as Xarray datasets. This facilitates the analysis of multidimensional geospatial data cubes described by STAC metadata.

tools.name: TorchGeo
tools.one_line_profile: PyTorch domain library for geospatial data loading, transformation, and modeling
tools.detailed_description: TorchGeo is a PyTorch domain library, similar to torchvision, that provides datasets, samplers, transforms, and pre-trained models specific to geospatial data. It simplifies the process of applying deep learning techniques to remote sensing data (satellite imagery, aerial photos) by handling geospatial indexing and coordinate reference systems.

tools.name: gfw_forest_loss_geotrellis
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed analysis pipeline for global tree cover loss using Geotrellis and Spark
tools.detailed_description: A Scala-based application developed by the World Resources Institute (WRI) for analyzing global forest loss. It utilizes Apache Spark and Geotrellis to process large-scale raster data, enabling the calculation of tree cover loss metrics over vast geographical areas.
